Global

Methods

apiRequest(path, data, onSuccess, onError)

Makes a post request to the Fireadmin API

Parameters:
Name Type Description
path String

Path of request within api. Required
data Object

Data to include in post request. Required
onSuccess function

Function that runs when request has completed successfully. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 672
Example
// Request to /upload with image object
apiRequest("upload", {img:imgObj}, function(res){
 console.log('Api request to upload completed successfully', res);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error requesting to upload:', err);
});

AppNameFromUrl(authData) → {String}

Extracts an app name out of a Firebase url

Parameters:
Name Type Description
authData String

Login data of new user
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 662
Returns:

appName App name extracted from url

Type
String

createUserProfile(authData, ref, onSuccess)

Create a new user profile under "users"

Parameters:
Name Type Description
authData Object

Login data of new user. Required
ref Reference

Main reference to create profile on. Required
onSuccess function

Function that runs when profile has been created sucessfully. Optional
Fireadmin~errorCb

onError Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 708
Example
// Create a new user profile
createUserProfile({email:test@test.com, password:'testtest'}, fa.ref, function(auth){
 console.log('Profile created successfully for user:', auth.uid);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error creating user profile:', err);
});

handleCb(callback, value)

Handle Callback functions by checking for existance and returning with val if avaialble

Parameters:
Name Type Description
callback function

Callback function to handle. Required
value string | object | array

Value to provide to callback function. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 764
Example
//Handle successCb
 function(uid, successCb, errorCb){
    ref.on('value', function(accountSnap){
     handleCb(successCb, accountSnap.val());
    }, function(err){
     handleCb(errorCb, err);
   });
 };
